subs.text:
Will a Republican respond to pressure and change? Not readily.

But people ridiculed their empty “thoughts and prayers” tweets so hard that those are rare now. In recent tweets, new phrases serve a similar function.

So it is possible to get a Republican to use different words.
subs.rawText:

subs.text: Or possibly Cameron is the name of the robot. [link]

subs.text: You know you're looking at a Republican elected official on Twitter from the one stock "I'm horrified" tweet on the day of the mass shooting and the silence on the subject every day that follows. [link]

subs.text: Walorski's silence is classic. You can reliably spot a Republican elected official on Twitter by the one stock "I'm horrified" tweet on the day of the mass shooting and the silence on the subject every day that follows. [link]

subs.text: In the final paragraphs, @TimDunlop raises the challenge of progressive media building together on their strengths. (With what tools, attitudes, affiliations . . . ? Interesting.) Relearning democracy, by @timdunlop [link]
